result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J. Mondor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks (>$2500), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation today (1/29/16).
May petition for review once restitution is paid in full.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in warrant.
Amended restitution ordered 4/16/19: $5,188.41 restitution, plus a 10% surcharge of $518.84, for a total of $5,707.25 to be paid to Probation.  See Amended Restitution Order for breakdown.
Must provide DNA sample.  No surcharge.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.
Other civil rights may be lost until restored.
If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

timeConds.notes: Banked/stayed for use by Probation if necessary

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
